lines.text: Travel is highly educational, Sir.
I cannot do with any more education, Jeeves. I was full up years ago!
He wants to marry Myrtle Snap?

Precisely so, Sir, but Mrs. Snap refuses to consider such a venture while Sir Roderick's daughter remains unmarried. In a colourful turn of phrase she stated that specific and scarcely to be anticipated meteorological conditions would have to take place in the infernal region before she would share a home with Miss Honoria.
And if *that* doesn't leave me without a stain on my conscience, then I don't know *what* it doesn't leave me without a stain on.
[greeting the Glossops before trying to prove his sanity]
What ho, what ho, what ho?
Am I to infer sir that you might be offering yourself for election?
Your inference is as always slap on the button and leading by a length in the final furlong, Jeeves.

[stuck looking after a dog]
What are you doing tonight, Jeeves?
I shall stay in with an improving book, Sir.
Wouldn't you rather stay in with an improving dog?
Yes! And, of course the old devil himself. Yes, he really put one up on the uncle didn't he? Thanks to Jeeves's masterpiece. What a wheeze!
Darling, this is a friend of mine, Mr. Wooster. Mr. Wooster I'd like you to meet my husband, Mr. Worple.
Husband? Huh! What rot!
...trying to improve my mind I dare say.
That seems scarcely possible sir.
You don't disapprove Jeeves?
It is hardly my place to say sir.
I know it's hardly your place to say Jeeves, that doesn't normally stop you.
